query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
1 Già eran li occhi miei rifissi al volto 2 de la mia donna, e l’animo con essi, 3 e da ogne altro intento s’era tolto.
query.error: **English:** 1 My eyes were already fixed again on the face 2 of my lady, and my soul with them, 3 and it had withdrawn from every other thought.
query.result: 1 Wæron ða mine eagan eft fæste 2 on ðære minre lafdian neb, and min mod mid him, 3 and wæs fram ælcon oðrum ðance awend.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
4 E quella non ridea; ma «S’io ridessi», 5 mi cominciò, «tu ti faresti quale 6 fu Semelè quando di cener fessi:
query.error: **English:** 4 And that one did not smile; but "If I smiled," 5 she began to me, "you would become like 6 Semele when she was turned to ashes:
query.result: 4 And ðæt ne hloh, ac "Gif ic hloh," 5 heo ða to me sprecan ongan, "ðu ðe wurde 6 swa Semele ða ða heo to ascan wearð:

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
7 ché la bellezza mia, che per le scale 8 de l’etterno palazzo più s’accende, 9 com’ hai veduto, quanto più si sale,
query.error: **English:** 7 for my beauty, which is kindled more 8 on the stairs of the eternal palace, 9 as you have seen, the higher one ascends,
query.result: 7 forðæm ðin fægernes, ðe ðurh ða stega 8 ðæs ecan huses ðy ma up astihð, 9 swa ðu gesawe, ðe hehror ðe man stihð,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
10 se non si temperasse, tanto splende, 11 che ’l tuo mortal podere, al suo fulgore, 12 sarebbe fronda che trono scoscende.
query.error: **English:** 10 if it were not tempered, shines so brightly 11 that your mortal power, in its brilliance, 12 would be like a branch that a thunderbolt strikes down.
query.result: 10 gif heo ne wære gemenged, swa scyneð, 11 ðæt ðin deadlic miht, on ðære beorhtnesse, 12 wære leaf ðe ðunor ofslihð.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
13 Noi sem levati al settimo splendore, 14 che sotto ’l petto del Leone ardente 15 raggia mo misto giù del suo valore.
query.error: **English:** 13 We rose to the seventh splendor, 14 which, beneath the breast of the burning Lion, 15 now mingles its radiance with his power.
query.result: 13 We arison ða on ðone seofoðan leoman, 14 se ðe scineð under ðæs leones breostan, 15 and his mihte mængeð his leoht nu.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
16 Ficca di retro a li occhi tuoi la mente, 17 e fa di quelli specchi a la figura 18 che ’n questo specchio ti sarà parvente».
query.error: **English:** 16 Fix your mind behind your eyes, 17 and make of them mirrors for the image 18 that will appear to you in this mirror.
query.result: 16 Fæst ðinne geþoht æfter ðinum eagum, 17 and wyrc ða speglas ðære ansyne, 18 ðe on ðisum spegle ðe bið æteowed.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
19 Qual savesse qual era la pastura 20 del viso mio ne l’aspetto beato 21 quand’ io mi trasmutai ad altra cura,
query.error: **English:** 19 If one could know what was the pasturage 20 of my face in that blessed aspect 21 when I changed to another care,
query.result: 19 Gif hwa wisse hwilc wæs ðæs læswe 20 mines ansynes on ðam beorhtan hiwe, 21 ða ic me wende to ðære wædle oðre,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
22 conoscerebbe quanto m’era a grato 23 ubidire a la mia celeste scorta, 24 contrapesando l’un con l’altro lato.
query.error: **English:** 22 he would know how pleasing it was to me 23 to obey my celestial escort, 24 weighing the one side against the other.
query.result: 22 he ða oncneowe hu me wæs leoflic 23 ðæt ic hyrde ðære heofonlican steore, 24 ða ic ða wæg ða twa healfa togædere.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
25 Dentro al cristallo che ’l vocabol porta, 26 cerchiando il mondo, del suo caro duce 27 sotto cui giacque ogne malizia morta,
query.error: **English:** 25 Within the crystal that bears the word, 26 circling the world, of its dear leader 27 under whom every evil lies dead,
query.result: 25 Binnon ðæm cristel ðe ðæt word bær, 26 ymb ðone world hweorfende, his leofan læredes, 27 ðæs ðe ælc yfel læg dead under,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
28 di color d’oro in che raggio traluce 29 vid’ io uno scaleo eretto in suso 30 tanto, che nol seguiva la mia luce.
query.error: **English:** 28 in a color of gold in which a ray shines through 29 I saw a stairway rising up 30 so high that my sight could not follow it.
query.result: 28 on ðære goldhwan hwær ðurh scineð, 29 ðær geseah ic ænne stegerearered up 30 swa heh ðæt min gesihð hine ne mihte folgian.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
31 Vidi anche per li gradi scender giuso 32 tanti splendor, ch’io pensai ch’ogne lume 33 che par nel ciel, quindi fosse diffuso.
query.error: **English:** 31 I also saw so many splendors descending down the steps, 32 that I thought that every light that appears in the sky 33 was diffused from there.
query.result: 31 Ic eac geseah ðurh ða stede stigan 32 swa fela wuldras ðæt ic wende ðæt æghwylc leoht, 33 ðe on ðam heofone bið, ðanon wære asended.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
34 E come, per lo natural costume, 35 le pole insieme, al cominciar del giorno, 36 si movono a scaldar le fredde piume;
query.error: **English:** 34 And as, by natural instinct, 35 the birds together, at the beginning of day, 36 move to warm their cold feathers;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
37 poi altre vanno via sanza ritorno, 38 altre rivolgon sé onde son mosse, 39 e altre roteando fan soggiorno;
query.error: **English:** 37 then some go away without returning, 38 others turn back to where they were moved from, 39 and others, wheeling, remain;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
40 tal modo parve me che quivi fosse 41 in quello sfavillar che ’nsieme venne, 42 sì come in certo grado si percosse.
query.error: **English:** 40 in such a manner it seemed to me that there was 41 in that sparkling which came together, 42 as if it struck itself at a certain level.
query.result: 40 swylce me ðuhte ðær ða ða wæron 41 on ðam scinendum ðe ðær tosomne com, 42 swa swa on sumum setle ða gesæton.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
43 E quel che presso più ci si ritenne, 44 si fé sì chiaro, ch’io dicea pensando: 45 ‘Io veggio ben l’amor che tu m’accenne.
query.error: **English:** 43 And the one who stayed closest to us, 44 became so bright that I said, thinking: 45 ‘I see well the love that you show me.
query.result: 43 And se ðe ðær neahst wæs ðe us genealæhte, 44 se wearð swa beorht ðæt ic ða cwæð ðencende: 45 ‘Ic geseo wel ða lufe ðe ðu me tæcest.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
46 Ma quella ond’ io aspetto il come e ’l quando 47 del dire e del tacer, si sta; ond’ io, 48 contra ’l disio, fo ben ch’io non dimando’.
query.error: **English:** 46 But she from whom I await the how and when 47 of speaking and of being silent, remains silent; therefore I, 48 against my desire, do well that I do not ask.
query.result: 46 Ac seo ðe ic bidan ðæt hu and ðæt hwænne 47 ðæs sprecende and ðæs suwigenne, ða geswogode; ða ic, 48 ongean ðone willan, wel dyde ðæt ic ne frægn.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
49 Per ch’ella, che vedëa il tacer mio 50 nel veder di colui che tutto vede, 51 mi disse: «Solvi il tuo caldo disio».
query.error: **English:** 49 Because she, who saw my silence 50 in the sight of Him who sees all, 51 said to me: "Resolve your burning desire."
query.result: 49 Forðæm heo, ðe geseah ðone min swegend, 50 on ðæs gesyhðe ðæs ðe eall gesyhð, 51 cwæð to me: "Alys ðinne hatan wilnunge."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
52 E io incominciai: «La mia mercede 53 non mi fa degno de la tua risposta; 54 ma per colei che ’l chieder mi concede,
query.error: **English:** 52 And I began: "My merit 53 does not make me worthy of your answer; 54 but for her who grants me to ask it,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
55 vita beata che ti stai nascosta 56 dentro a la tua letizia, fammi nota 57 la cagion che sì presso mi t’ha posta;
query.error: **English:** 55 blessed life that you are hidden 56 within your joy, make known to me 57 the reason that has placed me so near to you;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
58 e dì perché si tace in questa rota 59 la dolce sinfonia di paradiso, 60 che giù per l’altre suona sì divota».
query.error: **English:** 58 and tell me why the sweet symphony of paradise, 59 which resounds so devoutly down through the others, 60 is silent in this circle?"
query.result: 58 and sege me hwi ðeos swete symfonie 59 ðæs heofonlican leoðes, ðe ðurh ða oðre 60 swinsade swa swetlice, her swigað?"

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
61 «Tu hai l’udir mortal sì come il viso», 62 rispuose a me; «onde qui non si canta 63 per quel che Bëatrice non ha riso.
query.error: **English:** 61 "You have mortal hearing, just as you have mortal sight," 62 he replied to me; "therefore, there is no singing here 63 for what Beatrice has not smiled upon."
query.result: 61 "Þu hæfst ðone gehyrnesse swylce ðone gesihð," 62 andswarode he me; "forðæm her ne bið no gesungen 63 for ðæm ðe Beatrice ne hloh."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
64 Giù per li gradi de la scala santa 65 discesi tanto sol per farti festa 66 col dire e con la luce che mi ammanta;
query.error: **English:** 64 Down the steps of the holy stairway 65 I descended only to do you honor 66 with my words and with the light that envelops me;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
67 né più amor mi fece esser più presta, 68 ché più e tanto amor quinci sù ferve, 69 sì come il fiammeggiar ti manifesta.
query.error: **English:** 67 and it was not greater love that made me swifter, 68 for here above, love burns just as fiercely, 69 as the flames clearly show you.
query.result: 67 ne furðor lufe ne worhte ðæt ic wære geornlicor, 68 for ði ðe mare and swilce lufe her ufan yrnð, 69 swa swa ðæt fyrbæð ðe æteowð.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
70 Ma l’alta carità, che ci fa serve 71 pronte al consiglio che ’l mondo governa, 72 sorteggia qui sì come tu osserve».
query.error: **English:** 70 But the high charity, which makes us ready 71 to follow the counsel that governs the world, 72 draws lots here, as you can see.
query.result: 70 Ac se hehsta heofonlica lufa, ðe us gegearwiað 71 georne to ðæs rædes gehyran ðe ðone weorold stýreð, 72 hlotað her swa ðu geseo.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
73 «Io veggio ben», diss’ io, «sacra lucerna, 74 come libero amore in questa corte 75 basta a seguir la provedenza etterna;
query.error: **English:** 73 "I see well," I said, "sacred lamp, 74 how free love in this court 75 suffices to follow eternal providence;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
76 ma questo è quel ch’a cerner mi par forte, 77 perché predestinata fosti sola 78 a questo officio tra le tue consorte».
query.error: **English:** 76 but this is what seems hard to me to discern, 77 why you alone were predestined 78 to this office among your companions."
query.result: 76 ac ðis is ðæt ðe me ðynceð swīðe heard, 77 forðæm ðe ðū wære ānforesēwen 78 tō ðisum ærende betwēonum ðīnum geferum."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
79 Né venni prima a l’ultima parola, 80 che del suo mezzo fece il lume centro, 81 girando sé come veloce mola;
query.error: **English:** 79 Nor did I come to the last word, 80 before the center of its midst made light, 81 turning itself like a swift millstone;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
85 la cui virtù, col mio veder congiunta, 86 mi leva sopra me tanto, ch’i’ veggio 87 la somma essenza de la quale è munta.
query.error: **English:** 85 whose power, joined with my sight, 86 raises me above myself so much, that I see 87 the highest essence from which it flows.
query.result: 85 ðæs miht, mid ðære gesyhðe minre gemenged, 86 ahefð me ofer me selfne swa ðæt ic geseo 87 ðære hehstan gesceaft ðære he is of cumen."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
88 Quinci vien l’allegrezza ond’ io fiammeggio; 89 per ch’a la vista mia, quant’ ella è chiara, 90 la chiarità de la fiamma pareggio.
query.error: **English:** 88 Hence comes the joy with which I am aflame; 89 so that to my sight, as far as it is clear, 90 the brightness of the flame I match.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
91 Ma quell’ alma nel ciel che più si schiara, 92 quel serafin che ’n Dio più l’occhio ha fisso, 93 a la dimanda tua non satisfara,
query.error: **English:** 91 But that soul in heaven that shines the brightest, 92 that seraph who has his eye most fixed on God, 93 would not satisfy your request,
query.result: 91 Ac se ða sawl on heofonum ðe beorhtost scineð, 92 se seraphin ðe on Gode ðone eag ðone fæstestan hæfð, 93 ðinre bene ne gefylleð,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
94 però che sì s’innoltra ne lo abisso 95 de l’etterno statuto quel che chiedi, 96 che da ogne creata vista è scisso.
query.error: **English:** 94 because what you ask penetrates so deeply 95 into the abyss of the eternal decree 96 that it is cut off from every created sight.
query.result: 94 forðæm ðe ðæt ðu axast swa deoplice færð 95 on ðæs ecan rædes grund, 96 ðæt hit is fram æghwylcre gesceaft gesyhðe tosliten.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
97 E al mondo mortal, quando tu riedi, 98 questo rapporta, sì che non presumma 99 a tanto segno più mover li piedi.
query.error: **English:** 97 And to the mortal world, when you return, 98 report this, so that he may not presume 99 to set his feet toward such a mark.
query.result: 97 And to ðære deadlican worulde, ðonne ðu eft cyrst, 98 ðis sæge, ðæt he no ðæs swiðe ne wene 99 ðæt he ðæs mægnes mæðel-stede gesece.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
100 La mente, che qui luce, in terra fumma; 101 onde riguarda come può là giùe 102 quel che non pote perché ’l ciel l’assumma».
query.error: **English:** 100 The mind, which here shines, on earth smokes; 101 therefore, consider how it can see down there 102 what it could not because Heaven exalts it.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
103 Sì mi prescrisser le parole sue, 104 ch’io lasciai la quistione e mi ritrassi 105 a dimandarla umilmente chi fue.
query.error: **English:** 103 So his words prescribed for me, 104 that I left the question and humbly withdrew 105 to ask him who he was.
query.result: 103 Swa me his word on andsware gifeð, 104 ðæt ic ða spræce forlæt and me to him gewende 105 eaðmodlice ða andswarode and hine ðus clypode.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
106 «Tra ’ due liti d’Italia surgon sassi, 107 e non molto distanti a la tua patria, 108 tanto che ’ troni assai suonan più bassi,
query.error: **English:** 106 Between two shores of Italy rise rocks, 107 and not very far from your homeland, 108 so much so that the thunderbolts sound much lower,
query.result: 106 Betwux twæm landum Italie licgað stanas, 107 and nis naht feor ðinre eðele, 108 swa ðæt ðara ðundra mæst hlimmað,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
109 e fanno un gibbo che si chiama Catria, 110 di sotto al quale è consecrato un ermo, 111 che suole esser disposto a sola latria».
query.error: **English:** 109 and they make a hump that is called Catria, 110 beneath which a hermitage is consecrated, 111 which is usually dedicated to solitary worship.
query.result: 109 and ða wyrcað an hrycg ðe man Catria nemneð, 110 ðæs be neðan is geweorðod an eðel, 111 ðe bið gewunod to beonne anlic and ænlic.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
112 Così ricominciommi il terzo sermo; 113 e poi, continüando, disse: «Quivi 114 al servigio di Dio mi fe’ sì fermo,
query.error: **English:** 112 Thus the third spirit recommenced his discourse; 113 and then, continuing, he said: "There, 114 in the service of God, I made myself so steadfast,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
115 che pur con cibi di liquor d’ulivi 116 lievemente passava caldi e geli, 117 contento ne’ pensier contemplativi.
query.error: **English:** 115 that, with food consisting only of the juice of olives, 116 I passed through heat and cold with ease, 117 content in my contemplative thoughts.
query.result: 115 ðæt ic mid elebearwum lytlewæstmum 116 ðurhferde hæto and cealdo, 117 on ðam gesceadwisan ðonce geblissod."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
118 Render solea quel chiostro a questi cieli 119 fertilemente; e ora è fatto vano, 120 sì che tosto convien che si riveli.
query.error: **English:** 118 That cloister used to render to these heavens 119 fertilely; and now it has become empty, 120 so that it is soon necessary that it be revealed.
query.result: 118 Þæt closter sole wæs gewuna ðisum heofonum 119 fægerlice; and nu is geworden idel, 120 swa ðæt hraðe gebyreð ðæt hit gewítegod beo.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
121 In quel loco fu’ io Pietro Damiano, 122 e Pietro Peccator fu’ ne la casa 123 di Nostra Donna in sul lito adriano.
query.error: **English:** 121 In that place was I, Peter Damian, 122 and Peter the Sinner was in the house 123 of Our Lady on the Adriatic shore.
query.result: 121 On ðæm stowe wæs ic Petrus Damiani, 122 and Petrus Peccator wæs on ðæm huse 123 Sanctae Mariae on ðæm strande ðæs sæ.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
124 Poca vita mortal m’era rimasa, 125 quando fui chiesto e tratto a quel cappello, 126 che pur di male in peggio si travasa.
query.error: **English:** 124 Little of mortal life remained to me, 125 when I was asked and drawn to that cowl, 126 which truly changes from bad to worse.
query.result: 124 Lytle hwile wæs me lifes lafe, 125 ða ic wæs beden and broht to ðam cæppe, 126 ðe yfel for yfle oft geweorðeð.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
127 Venne Cefàs e venne il gran vasello 128 de lo Spirito Santo, magri e scalzi, 129 prendendo il cibo da qualunque ostello.
query.error: **English:** 127 Cephas came and the great vessel 128 of the Holy Spirit, masters and barefoot, 129 taking food from any inn.
query.result: 127 Com Ceofas and ðæt micle fat 128 ðæs Halgan Gastes, mæstras and barfotas, 129 nimðe mete of ælcere wicstowe.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
130 Or voglion quinci e quindi chi rincalzi 131 li moderni pastori e chi li meni, 132 tanto son gravi, e chi di rietro li alzi.
query.error: **English:** 130 Either from here or there they want someone to push forward 131 the modern shepherds and someone to lead them, 132 so burdened are they, and someone to lift them up from behind.
query.result: 130 Oððe willað her and ðær ðe hine ræran 131 ða niwan hyrdas and ða lædan, 132 swa higebyrðene sind, and ða æfterfyligan.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
133 Cuopron d’i manti loro i palafreni, 134 sì che due bestie van sott’ una pelle: 135 oh pazïenza che tanto sostieni!».
query.error: **English:** 133 They stripped the palfreys of their mantles, 134 so that two beasts go under one skin: 135 oh patience, that endures so much!
query.result: 133 Hi benamon heora mantela ðam horsum, 134 swa ðæt twa nytenu farað under anum felle: 135 ea, geðyld, ðu ðe swa fela þolað!

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
136 A questa voce vid’ io più fiammelle 137 di grado in grado scendere e girarsi, 138 e ogne giro le facea più belle.
query.error: **English:** 136 At this voice I saw more flames 137 descend and circle from level to level, 138 and each circle made them more beautiful.
query.result: 136 Æt ðære stefne ic geseah ma flamena 137 of ðære byrig stigan and hweorfan, 138 and æghwylc hwyrf hit fægerran macode.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
139 Dintorno a questa vennero e fermarsi, 140 e fero un grido di sì alto suono, 141 che non potrebbe qui assomigliarsi;
query.error: **English:** 139 Around this one they came and stopped, 140 and they made a cry of such a loud sound, 141 that it could not be likened here;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
142 né io lo ’ntesi, sì mi vinse il tuono.
query.error: **English:** 142 nor did I hear it, so much did the thunder overcome me.
query.result: 142 ne ic ðæt gehlyste, swa me ðunor ðeah.
